roleset.name: make moderate
roleset.note: MODERATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'moderate' based on sentences in wsj. VN class other_cos-45.4. (from moderate.01-v)

role.descr: thing that would be extreme otherwise
specific aspect of arg1 that is moderate

example.name: agentive
example.text: Some climate models project that interior regions of Asia would be among the first to heat up in a global warming because they are far from oceans, which *trace* moderate temperature changes.

example.name: ergative
example.text: At the same time, last week's consumer price index showed that inflation is moderating.

example.name: nominal rel: moderation
example.text: Obviously , we continue to see signs of moderation , but let 's remember this is still the longest and strongest boom in all of American history .

roleset.name: to preside over; proctor, preside over, proctor
roleset.note: MODERATE-V NOTES: Based on sentence in Bolt data. Comparison to preside and monitor. No VN class. Framed by Katie. (from moderate.02-v)

example.name: arg1
example.text: President Mubarak is a strong supporter of moderation of the Arab - Israeli conflict .

roleset.name: mild, of a medium amount; not excessive
roleset.note: MODERATE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1. (from moderate.01-j)

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 that is moderate

example.name: arg1
example.text: Nice to see that those lacking a religion are now a majority , although thankfully [UK Christians]-1 tend [*-1]to be very reserved and moderate unlike their US counterparts .

example.name: both args
example.text: most students surveyed were moderate in their views about alcohol use.
example.arg: in their views about alcohol use
